pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:5.1: 33. The training rule on in order
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate almsfood picking here and there. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:7.2: “‘I will eat almsfood in order,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:8.1: Almsfood is to be eaten in order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:8.2: If a monk eats almsfood picking here and there out of disrespect, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:9.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:10.1: The third training rule is finished.
